Dear Tia M. Cobb:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Chief administrator; responsibilities.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4116
Section (1) An agency shall assign the chief administrator responsibility for
Description the onsite day-to-day operation of the institution and for ensuring
compliance with these rules.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Facility failed to submit their Corrective Action Plan timely
Investigation Administrator was interviewed via phone on December 17,
2024. Administrator reported she received emails from this
consultant about the need to complete her Corrective Action Plan
(CAP) for Special Investigation 2025SIC0000003. She reported
she has been struggling with the CWLM system to enter the CAP.
This consultant asked if Administrator saw on the emails on
December 3, 2024, and December 6, 2024, that the word CAP
template could be completed as an alternative method, and she
stated that she is seeing that now. Administrator reported the
facility has been struggling with multiple investigations and she
has been trying to keep up with everything. She reported she
thought she had communicated with this consultant about her
struggles with the CWLM but now she sees she has not.
Administrator reported she is going to send a draft of the CAP
today.
Documents Reviewed:
Email between Administrator and this consultant:
- November 12 ,2024- Consultant emailed Administrator the
special investigation report stating the Corrective Action
Plan (CAP) would be due on November 27, 2024.
Consultant offered support if there was assistance needed
with the CAP
- November 26, 2024- Consultant sent a reminder email to
the Administrator that the CAP would be the next day. This
consultant received an out of office email from the
Administrator is out for the Thanksgiving Holiday.
- December 2, 2024- Consultant sent an email to the
Administrator that the CAP was overdue but wanted to
send a reminder due to Administrator being out of the office
for the holiday.
- December 3, 2024- Consultant sent an officially CAP late
letter to Administrator. This consultant offered to help
2

Administrator if she was having issues with the CWLM
system. A CAP template word document was also attached
to the email as another way for the Administrator to send
the CAP to this consultant. The due date was made for
December 5, 2024.
- December 6, 2024- Consultant sent another CAP late latter
to Administrator with the Licensee Designee attached
stating there still has been no response from the
Administrator in regard to this CAP. This consultant offered
to help Administrator if she was having issues with the
CWLM system. A CAP template word document was also
attached to the email as another way for the Administrator
to send the CAP to this consultant. The new due date was
made for December 13, 2024.
- December 17, 2024- Consultant sent an email to
Administrator and Licensee Designee stating there has
been no communication or documentation sent in regard to
this CAP.
- December 17, 2024- Administrator responded to the email
stating she thought she emailed this consultant about the
multiple problems she had been having with the CWLM
system and could not get the CAP uploaded. She reported
she would get the CAP to this consultant same day or next
day.
- December 17, 2024- A draft of the CAP was sent to this
consultant on the CAP template word document.
CAP Late Letter dated December 9, 2024, from Licensing
Consultant 2 to Administrator- Licensing Consultant 2 provided
Administrator a Corrective Action Plan (CAP) late letter on
December 9, 2024 which laid out the difficulties of receiving the
CAP timely. Within this letter Licensing Consultant 2 explained:
- The CAP was originally due on September 28, 2024, but
was not received until October 3, 2024.
- On October 15, 2024, CAP revisions were received.
- On October 24, 2024, a video conference was held to
discuss CAP corrections and CAP corrections were
provided to Administrator. Corrections were noted to be
due on October 31, 2024.
- On November 6, 2024, a CAP late letter was sent to
Administrator noting the corrections were not received yet
from the due date of October 31, 2024. Licensing
Consultant 2 requested a response by November 7, 2024.
3

- On November 15, 2024, another CAP late letter was sent to
Administrator requesting a response by November 22,
2024.
- On November 26, 2024, another CAP later letter was sent
to Administrator which Licensing Consultant 2 offered to
provide a video conference to complete the corrections in
the CWLM system together or complete the CAP on the
attached word document in lieu of completion of CWLM
due to technical difficulties.
- On December 2, 2024, a reminder email was sent to
Administrator requesting the CAP to be completed by end
of day on December 3, 2024.
Email from Administrator to Licensing Consultant 2- On
December 13, 2024, and December 20, 2024, Administrator sent
Licensing Consultant 2 drafts of the CAP for review.
Analysis The facility is found in violation as the Chief Administrator did not
turn in the Corrective Active Plans timely after several CAP late
letters were sent, and assistance was offered and not utilized.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
